column1: The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club
column2: including the head coach
column3: the director of the club
column4: and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings
column5: which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper
column8: and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

column1: Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment
column2: the scout submits a scouting report about the player
column3: which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player

column1: After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile
column2: the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the shortlist. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments ¨C some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout
column3: the director makes an official offer for the player.

column1: The Team Sports Scouting System involves various roles within the club
column2: including the Head Coach
column3: Director
column5: and Players. The system manages player profiles

column1: The Head Coach is responsible for identifying player profiles and making decisions on player signings. The Director handles official offers for players recommended by the scouting team. Scouts gather information on potential players and submit scouting reports with recommendations. Players are individuals within the club who are being scouted for potential recruitment.
Scouting assignments track the progress of scouting activities
column2: while scout reports provide detailed evaluations of players. Player profiles define the attributes and positions of players being scouted.
